zeros¶

isopy.zeros(rows, keys=None, *, ndim=None, dtype=<class 'numpy.float64'>)[source]¶

Create an isopy array filled with zeros.

Parameters

  • rows (int, None) – Number of rows in the returned array. A value of -1 or None will return a 0-dimensional array unless overridden by ndim.

  • keys (Sequence[str], Optional) – Column names for the returned array. Can also be inferred from dtype if dtype is a named np.dtype.

  • ndim ({-1, 0, 1}, Optional) – Dimensions of the final array. A value of -1 will return an 0-dimensional array if size is 1 otherwise a 1-dimensional array is returned. An exception is raised if value is 0 and size is not -1 or 1.

  • dtype (numpy_dtype, Sequence[numpy_dtype]) – Data type of returned array. A sequence of data types can given to specify different datatypes for different columns in the final array.
